title: Wetzel: A defense of the CFP committee? It's not perfect, but nothing in this sport can be
content: Don't overreact to this year's playoff rankings by blowing up the system. Chasing perfection is a fool's errand.

title: CFP Anger Index: An absurd farce over Notre Dame, Miami
content: Evaluating the committee's ranking process, and what teams should be most upset about in final CFP ranking.

title: Sources: Colts lose QB Jones to torn Achilles
content: Colts quarterback Daniel Jones suffered a season-ending torn Achilles in the first quarter of Sunday's loss to the Jaguars.

title: LaFleur: Win vs. Johnson-led Bears not personal
content: If Matt LaFleur said anything to Bears coach Ben Johnson after Sunday's game at Lambeau Field, it couldn't have been much considering the Packers coach barely broke stride.

title: Jeff Kent elected to HOF; Bonds, Clemens still out
content: Jeff Kent was elected to the National Baseball Hall of Fame by the contemporary era committee on Sunday. Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens were named on fewer than five ballots.

title: Reid owns 4th-down flop as K.C. playoff hopes dim
content: "In hindsight, it was wrong," Chiefs coach Andy Reid said of his fourth-down decision late in Sunday night's game against Houston that led to an eventual 20-10 loss. "I messed that one up."

title: Irish say no bowl after CFP snub, rankings 'farce'
content: Notre Dame AD Pete Bevacqua told ESPN that the program is in utter disbelief after being snubbed by the CFP, with the Irish instead not playing in any bowl game this season.

title: Cashman: Gray put Yankees in mix to raise value
content: After his arrival for Major League Baseball's winter meetings Sunday night in Orlando, Florida, Yankees general manager Brian Cashman told reporters that new Boston starter Sonny Gray expressed a desire to play in New York to raise his free agency value.

title: LeBron bounces back, nets season-high 29 in win
content: A game after he failed to reach 10 points for the first time in 17 years, LeBron James produced an impressive fourth quarter Sunday night, posting 10 straight points in lifting the Lakers to a 112-108 victory over the 76ers.

title: Overturned Likely TD among Ravens' ref issues
content: After a critical 27-22 loss to the rival Steelers, many of the Ravens questioned calls made by the referees -- notably an overturned touchdown reception by Isaiah Likely in the fourth quarter -- that ultimately could cost them a chance at the postseason.

title: How Week 14 shook up the NFL playoff picture: What now for the Colts, Chiefs, Ravens and Bears?
content: Daniel Jones' injury, the Ravens' red zone woes, the Bears' defensive mistakes and the Chiefs' drop issues meant big changes in the race for the postseason.

title: What do Week 14 games mean for the rest of the season?
content: Our reporters react to the action, answering lingering questions and detailing what you need to know.

title: Will Daniel Jones start for the Colts in '26? Is the front office safe? Key questions for Indy
content: Will coach Shane Steichen and GM Chris Ballard survive a late-season freefall? What's next at QB in Indy?

title: Behind Saquon Barkley's dip in production after career year: Can the Eagles fix it?
content: A drastic turnaround for Barkley might feel far-fetched, but notable improvement in the run game is attainable.

title: Everything we know about the Heat's trade for Terry Rozier -- and whether he could be dealt again
content: Terry Rozier, who is scheduled to be arraigned Monday for his alleged role in a betting scheme, was traded to Miami in 2024 without any investigation being disclosed.

title: MLB winter meetings updates, rumors and predictions: What big moves will go down in Orlando?
content: From predicting who will sign to the latest buzz from Florida, here's everything you need as baseball's hot stove season heats up.

title: The NHL's best this week: Terry Ryan and hockey dreams
content: From first-round draft pick to iconic character, Ryan's path is a unique one. Plus, this week's key NHL games.

title: In winning F1 title, Norris proves himself (and his doubters) wrong
content: Lando Norris doubted himself as a title contender earlier this year. Now, as the curtain falls on the F1 season, he can call himself a world champion.

title: Week 14 winners and losers: Josh Allen, Jaxon Smith-Njigba deliver; Jonathan Taylor, Bijan Robinson struggle
content: Josh Allen, Puka Nacua and Jaxon Smith-Njigba led the way with big Week 14 performances, while Jonathan Taylor, Bijan Robinson and Ashton Jeanty were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Fantasy buzz: Injuries pile up in Week 14, as three QBs and Achane, Ertz go down
content: Injuries were problematic with De'Von Achane and Jayden Daniels among the players who left their games early.

title: Man City have a history of overtaking Arsenal; can the Gunners hold their nerve?
content: It appears this Premier League title race can be summed up with one question: Can Arsenal can hold their nerve with Man City breathing down their necks?

title: Matsuyama rallies to win Hero Challenge in playoff
content: Hideki Matsuyama won the Hero World Challenge on Sunday when he closed with an 8-under 64 and then hit 9-iron to 2 feet for birdie on the first playoff hole to defeat Alex Noren.

title: What's next for new champions Petr Yan and Joshua Van after UFC 323?
content: With Alexandre Pantoja injured, another young talent could be a natural fit to challenge men's flyweight champion Joshua Van.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Diomande as Salah replacement
content: Liverpool scouts have been watching 19-year-old RB Leipzig winger Yan Diomande and he could replace Mohammed Salah. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Andhra Pradesh posts 11.28% growth in Q2, Naidu says State is on revival mode
content: Chief Minister says reforms and faster decision-making driving turnaround; blames previous regime for ₹7 lakh crore GSDP loss and heavy debt burden

title: Strict action will be taken to set an example: Civil Aviation Minister on IndiGo crisis
content: Flight Duty Time Limitations (FDTL) guideline, which was framed after a court order in April 2025, was brought into place after multiple consultations, he tells Parliament

title: First phase of Kerala local body polls on Tuesday; voting to begin at 7 a.m.
content: Votes will be polled from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. for Phase-I of the local body elections covering wards in 595 local bodies across Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Idukki, Alappuzha, and Ernakulam districts.

title: The Hindu Future India Club seminar in Guntur on December 9
content: The programme on ‘Careers in Management and Sciences’ will feature interactive discussions designed to help students make informed academic and professional choices

title: Parliament clears bill to levy cess on pan masala manufacturing units
content: The Rajya Sabha returned the Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, to the Lok Sabha. The bill was approved by the Lower House on Friday.

title: Thousands witness consecration of Ekambaranatha temple in Kancheepuram
content: The mahakumbhabhishekam of the temple, considered one of the pancha bhutha sthalas (temples for five elements), was performed after a gap of 17 years

title: Safari ban row: Tourism sector wants revival, farmers cite safety concerns
content: Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha claims that fear persists in forest-fringe villages following the recent tiger attacks, even as the debate over suspension of safaris in Nagarahole and Bandipur reserves deepens

title: Seven States contribute more to total taxes than their share in devolutions from the Centre
content: These figures are of relevance now because the 16th Finance Commission, tasked with deciding the devolution formula for the period 2026-31, last month submitted its recommendations to the government.

title: Couple dies in road accident in Koppal district after pre-wedding shoot
content: A young couple, who were soon to be married, died in a road accident near Chikkabenakal village in Gangavati taluk of Koppal district on Sunday night

title: BRS releases chargesheet on 2-year Congress rule, says its 24 months of miseries
content: Party leader Harish Rao alleges that the Revanth Reddy Govt. has betrayed all from students to aged persons on pre-poll promises

title: T.N. govt. amends rules revising average space norms for women in hostels, homes
content: Hostels or homes are to ensure accommodation with an average space of 50 sq. ft per woman. Earlier, it was 120 sq. ft per woman

title: Long-pending demands push NIMS nurses to launch black badge protest
content: Protest over increasing workload, restoration of medical services to parents of contract nursing officers, filling of vacant posts, appropriate status and pay for lecturers at NIMS Nursing College and their spouses

title: Special Commissioner cracks down on fleecing of Sabarimala pilgrims
content: Sabarimala Special Commissioner inspects Erumely  town  and issues a series of directives to step up enforcement

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Putin's India Visit Was Bigger Than Just 'Deals'
content: The significance of the 27-hour-long visit lies less in the agreements concluded and more in the strategic message it conveyed, that the bilateral partnership retains its own momentum,largelyinsulated from external constraints.

title: Vacation Turns Into Tragedy, Delhi Woman Loses Husband, Sisters In Goa Fire
content: A night of music and dance turned fatal in Goa after a fire at a jampacked nightclub claimed 25 lives - 20 staff and five tourists - after midnight on Sunday.

title: Posters Asking Nitish Kumar's Son To Take Over JDU Command Surface In Bihar
content: Nishant Kumar has shown no interest in political activities or in joining his father's party, JD(U), while Nitish Kumar himself has repeatedly stated that he does not wish to push his son into politics.

title: IndiGo Stock Plunges 10%, Wiping Out Rs 37,000 Crore In Market Value
content: InterGlobe Aviation Limited, the parent company of IndiGo, saw its market value shrink sharply on Monday as the airline continued to grapple with one of the worst travel disruptions in India's aviation history.

title: "Organised Loot": Raghav Chadha Slams Highway Toll Collection In Rajya Sabha
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Raghav Chadha on Monday called the country's highway toll collection an "organised loot", saying mismanagement and excessive charges were placing an "unbearable" burden on commuters.

title: IndiGo Cancels 562 Flights From Six Metro Airports On Monday
content: Rahul Bhatia-controlled domestic carrier IndiGo on Monday cancelled 562 flights from six metro airports, with 150 cancellations originating from Bengaluru airport alone, according to sources.

title: "Once And For All, Let's Close It": Priyanka Gandhi's 'Advice' To PM On Nehru
content: The time Jawaharlal Nehru, the country's first Prime Minister, spent in jail during the freedom struggle is close to the period Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been in the country's top post, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said

title: Pawan Kalyan Says Dharma, Constitution Are "Same", Congress Responds
content: A political storm has erupted after Jana Sena Party chief and Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan equated Dharma with the Indian Constitution during his address at the Sri Krishna Mutt in Karnataka's Udupi.

title: "Understand Real Vande Mataram Chronology": Priyanka Gandhi's Dig At Centre
content: The debate on the national song "Vande Mataram" on its 150th anniversary in parliament saw a spirited defence of the Congress from its senior leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.

title: Cost Of Home-Cooked Veg, Non-Veg Thalis Dip By 13% In November: Report
content: Riding on the decline in prices of vegetables and pulses, the cost of preparing home-cooked vegetarian and non-vegetarian thalis fell 13 per cent each on a year-on-year basis in November, according to Crisil's monthly indicator of food plate cost.

title: Supreme Court Plans Guidelines To Stop Insensitive Orders, Comments On Rape Cases
content: The Supreme Court today expressed concern over controversial and "anti-women orders" passed by courts across the country in rape and sexual assault cases. To check this issue, a detailed set of guidelines would be issued for high courts, it said.

title: "Listen Carefully": Navjot Kaur Sidhu Clarifies "Rs 500 Crore" Remark After Political Storm
content: Navjot Kaur Sidhu -- the wife of cricketer-turned -politician Navjot Singh Sidhu -- has issued a detailed clarification on social media platform X on her explosive comment that "the one who gives a suitcase of Rs 500 crore becomes the Chief Minister.

title: Video: Car Flips After Thar Rams It At Gurugram Toll Plaza, Driver Arrested
content: The banner on the toll plaza read "Wishing You A Pleasant And Safe Journey". A few metres ahead, a black Thar rammed a white hatchback, showed a disturbing video from Gurugram.

title: "When Done Nehru-Bashing, Debate Unemployment": Priyanka Gandhi's Top Quotes
content: Vande Matram, the national song, is alive in every part of the country, underlined Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra in the Lok Sabha as she spoke during a special discussion marking 150 years of the song on Monday.

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 6 LIVE Updates -  "Let's Close The Chapter...": Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's Nehru Debate Suggestion
content: Parliament holds a special discussion on Vande Mataram in both Houses as the national song completes 150 years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi initiated the debate at 12 noon today, marking the formal beginning of the proceedings.

title: "Rot In Hell, You Bas****": Indian-Origin Nurse Convicted For 2018 Murder
content: Toyah Cordingley's body was discovered half-buried in an isolated section of sand dunes at Wangetti Beach, about 40km north of Cairns, on October 22, 2018.

title: "Sky Isn't The Limit": Air India In Pilot Hiring Ad Amid IndiGo Crisis
content: The sky is not the limit; it's just the beginning, says Air India in a hiring advertisement calling pilots to apply for a career in the Tata group company.

title: With Top Maoist Ramdher's Surrender, Madhya Pradesh Almost Insurgency-Free
content: In what is being described as the final collapse of the Maoist structure, Central Committee Member Ramdher Majji, one of the most feared and powerful Maoist leaders, surrendered along with 11 top cadres in the early hours of Monday.

title: "Bengal Neglects Bankim Chatterjee": Great Grandson Amid Vande Mataram Debate
content: A political row broke out last month when Prime Minister Narendra Modi accused the Congress of dropping important stanzas of 'Vande Mataram' during the 1937 session of the party.

title: Putin Visit Raised US Concern On India-Russia Ties: Expert To NDTV
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's high-profile visit to New Delhi has reignited debate in Washington over India's growing proximity to Moscow, at a time when global geopolitical alignments are shifting rapidly.

title: KITS Guntur hosts Smart India Hackathon 2025 grand final
content: The 36-hour event, held simultaneously at nodal centres across the country, is showcasing 1,360 teams of young innovators addressing real-world problems

title: Tamil Nadu forms expert panel to draft comprehensive SOP for elephant translocation
content: The government forms the committee following concerns voiced over the death of two translocated elephants in recent months. It has asked the committee to submit a draft SOP in two months

title: Woman, daughter found dead after killing 14-year-old boy in Bengaluru
content: In a suspected murder-suicide pact case in the Suddaguntepalya police limits on Monday, a 68-year-old woman and her daughter were found dead after allegedly killing the latter’s 14-year-old son at their house

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: IndiGo cancels 562 flights from six metro airports; 150 at Bengaluru alone
content: Number is higher than projections given by the Civil Aviation Ministry, which earlier in the day said the carrier was looking to operate 1,802 flights besides cancelling 500 services on December 8

title: Belagavi session must focus on North Karnataka’s burning issues, says Samiti
content: The Kalyana Karnataka Horata Samiti has urged the State government to ensure that the Belagavi Legislature Session, which began on Monday, is completely devoted to addressing the long-pending and urgent issues of North Karnataka region

title: I am confident of my father completing full term, says Yathindra
content: The MLC and son of CM Siddaramaiah said that so far, the Congress high command had not asked his father to come to Delhi after the session.

title: Farmer group protests against Electricity Amendment Bill
content: The call for State-wide protests were given by Samyukt Kisan Morcha and the protests were also joined by the employees' unions of the State power utility

title: Karnataka Winter Session: Day 1 sees thin attendance of members in Assembly
content: While there were around 55 members from the Opposition benches, the ruling benches accounted roughly for another 55 members.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Police team leaves for Delhi to arrest owners; fifth accused held
content: Bharat, 49, who was responsible for managing the daily operations of the establishment on behalf of the owners, is the fifth accused taken into custody.

title: Cold wave alert in Telangana dists on December 9; 12 dists record below 10°C
content: Kohir in Sangareddy district recorded the lowest temperature in the State at 7.2°C between December 7 and 8 mornings

title: ‘It was BJP event, how could I attend it?’: Mamata on skipping Bhagavad Gita recitation programme
content: The event, which took place on Sunday (December 7), had a footfall of several lakhs and was seen as a show of Hindu identity ahead of the 2026 Assembly elections

title: Goa Government constitutes four-member panel to probe nightclub fire
content: Under Secretary (Home) Manthan Manoj Naik issued the order constituting the inquiry committee with North Goa District Collector Ankit Yadav as chairperson

title: Watch: How the rape case against Malayalam actor Dileep unfolded
content: Eight years after the abduction and sexual assault of a leading actress, a Ernakulam District and Sessions Court found six people guilty, but acquitted actor Dileep in the case. Here’s a timeline of the case.

title: Thirupparankundram case: INDIA bloc to move an impeachment motion against Justice G.R. Swaminathan
content: “We are collecting signatures of the India Bloc MPs and will submit them to the Parliament (on December 9),” said CPI(M) Su. Venkatesan

title: ITR forms under new Income Tax Act to be notified prior to FY28: MoS Pankaj Chaudhary
content: The new Act will replace the existing Income Tax Act, 1961, and make tax laws simple and reduce wordage in the legislation making it easy to understand

title: ECI appoints five senior IAS officers as Special Roll Observers for SIR in West Bengal
content: An official at the CEO’s office said the appointment of Special Roll Observers (SRO) would ensure “enhanced scrutiny and transparency” in the process

title: In a sign of thaw, Manipur Meitei MLA visits Kuki villages
content: Former Speaker Yumnam Khemchand Singh is the first political leader to start people-to-people contact since the bloody ethnic conflict that broke out in May 2023

title: 22 MLAs from ruling ally 'close' to Fadnavis, ready to cross over, claims Aaditya
content: There is one party and two factions on the treasury side. Twenty-two MLAs from one faction have grown close to the CM. They have good funds, and they have started dancing to the tune of the CM," says Aaditya Thackeray

title: Congress Ministers blame Centre for problems faced by sugarcane, maize farmers in Karnataka
content: Ministers Dinesh Gundu Rao, N. Cheluvarayaswamy and Madhu Bangarappa have blamed the union government for the problems plaguing the farmers particularly sugarcane and maize growers.

title: Uma Thomas says her husband’s soul will never be satisfied with the verdict
content: “Will PT’s soul be satisfied with this verdict? Never. The concerns shared by the survivor many times during the course of the trial have proved to be correct. With her, unconditionally,” Uma Thomas wrote in her FB post.

title: Mandya key to India achieving 20% ethanol blending with petrol target: S.E. Sudheendra
content: Karnataka State Bioenergy Development Board had set up a stall at Krishi Mela in Mandya to share information on its ongoing bioenergy action plans, and the proposed Bioenergy Policy

title: Suitcase culture is in BJP, not Congress, says Karnataka Minister Dr. Sharanprakash Patil
content: Minister for Medical Education Dr. Sharanprakash Patil alleges that the ‘culture’ of giving the post of Cm by taking money is in BJP not in Congress, because the Congress government had been elected by the people of Karnataka

title: False story created against me has finally collapsed: Dileep
content: Actor Dileep, reacting to the verdict, said in his statement that a police-led conspiracy and false narrative targeted him for years. He expressed deep gratitude to his family, supporters, and legal team for standing by him over nine years, adding that he is extremely happy and relieved after the court’s decision.

title: YSRCP slams NDA govt. over ₹381 crore pending MGNREGA wages
content: Party alleges wage arrears remain uncleared for six months and says reduced workdays under the present regime led to an income loss of ₹435 crore for rural families

title: Goa nightclub fire: Owner Saurabh Luthra expresses grief, assures management support
content: A massive fire at the nightclub, some 25 kilometres away from here, late Saturday night killed 25 persons

title: A.P. RERA instructs urban local bodies to issue building occupancy certificates (OC) only to those registered with it
content: Authority flags nearly 25% unregistered builders; urges buyers to avoid projects that do not comply with RERA norms.

title: Narrow escape for tourists as bus catches fire during safari at Nahargarh biological park in Jaipur
content: According to park authorities, all the tourists quickly alighted from the vehicle when smoke was detected

title: HR&CE dept. can inquire into maladministration of denominational temples too, rules Madras High Court
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohammed Shaffiq say, such temples will take the character of a public institution if they receive donations from devotees

title: Congress hits back at PM Modi, calls him 'master distorian'
content: The party also slammed the Prime Minister for accusing Jawaharlal Nehru of following appeasement politics

title: Red Fort blast case: Delhi court extends NIA custody of three doctors, preacher by four days
content: Mediapersons were barred from covering the court proceedings, which were held under tight security in and around the Patiala House district court premises

title: Supreme Court grants bail to banned Jharkhand group's zonal commander in extortion, terror financing case
content: The court passed the order despite the National Investigation Agency (NIA), opposing Bhokta's plea challenging a Jharkhand High Court order denying him bail

title: Winter session begins with Karnataka Assembly paying tributes to Salumarada Thimmakka, S.L. Bhyrappa, H.Y. Meti and others
content: Tributes were also paid to Kannada cine actor M.S. Umesh, known for his comedy roles, and former MLAs R.V. Devaraj and Shivasharanappagouda Patil

title: Protests by MES and KRV on first day of winter session in Belagavi, activists detained
content: On the first day of the winter session of the Karnataka legislature on December 8, activists of MES were detained while heading to ‘Maha Melava’

title: Andhra Minister Savitha inspects tribal welfare hostel
content: During her visit, Minister Savitha inspected the accommodation provided to the students, quality of the food, water supply and sanitation in the hostel

title: ED attaches ₹4,190 cr in crypto cases, declares one accused as Fugitive Economic Offender
content: The CBDT has sent 44,057 communications to taxpayers who invested or traded in VDAs but did not report these in their Income Tax Returns, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said in a written reply to a question in the Lok Sabha

title: Supreme Court seeks ED's response on journalist's bail plea in money laundering case
content: The Supreme Court on September 8 sought responses from the Gujarat government and the ED on Mr. Langa's bail plea

title: DMK will form government again with support of over 2.5 crore voters: M.K. Stalin
content: He was addressing party functionaries for the programme ‘My Booth – My Victory’ through a virtual meeting to review the Election Commission of India’s ongoing Special Intensive Revision

title: Kerala actor rape case: V.D. Satheesan says verdict a ‘relief’, calls for stronger systems to protect women
content: This verdict was made possible thanks to the strong stance adopted by the former Thrikkakara MLA, the late P. T. Thomas. If not for him, there would not have been a case in the first place, says Satheesan

title: IndiGo flight disruptions: Opposition demands statement from government; Ram Mohan Naidu assures strict adherence to safety protocols
content: As the Indigo flight disruptions extend into a seventh day, Union Minister Ram Mohan Naidu assures strict adherence to safety protocols and ongoing investigations into the airline’s operational issues

title: Police facilitate shifting of woman’s dead body to her native place
content: Anantapur III Town Inspector Rajendranath Yadav and other police personnel helped the deceased woman’s son transport the body in an ambulance with their own money

title: Woman student dies at hospital, Patnaik demands strict action against culprits
content: This was the fifth such incident in the State in a span of six months when women died in a similar manner in Balasore, Puri, Kendrapara, Bargarh and now Rajgangpur

title: Kerala actor rape case: Kerala government to appeal Dileep’s acquittal
content: State Law Minister Rajeeve says he has spoken to Chief Minister and that the government has decided to appeal against the verdict. The prosecution has been directed to take the initial steps in this regard.

title: Mehbooba slams Centre over Vande Mataram debate, says BJP indulging in 'empty symbolism'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi initiates the debate on the 150th anniversary of Vande Mataram in Lok Sabha on Monday (December 8, 2025); it is expected to bring to light several important and previously unknown facets about the national song

title: Work to lift gopuram of Sri Kalikambal Temple in Chennai begins
content: Already, around 25 temples in the State, including the Raviswarar Temple in Vyasarpadi, have been or are being lifted to prevent flooding

title: MEA to China: 'Assure Indians won't be targeted'; gives 'no interference' in Arunachal memo
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has urged Chinese authorities to ensure fair treatment for Indian travelers transiting through their airports. This statement follows reports of alleged harassment of an Arunachal Pradesh woman, prompting an advisory for Indian nationals to exercise caution when traveling to or through China.

title: Vande Mataram debate: Priyanka's 'chronology' jab at Centre; questions PM's 'selective' history
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the Lok Sabha, accusing him of lacking historical facts in his Vande Mataram debate. She highlighted Rabindranath Tagore's first rendition at a Congress convention and the song's role in the freedom struggle, contrasting it with the PM's narrative of Congress compromises.

title: The trillion-dollar shock: What tariff? How Xi Jinping beat Trump in trade war
content: Despite nearly a decade of US tariffs, China's trade surplus has surged to a record $1.08 trillion, demonstrating its resilience and dominance in global exports. China has successfully restructured its supply chains, rerouted exports to emerging markets, and leveraged currency advantages to bypass tariff barriers, outmaneuvering US trade war strategies.

title: IPL 2026: What CSK need & who they must target ahead of auctions - Check out
content: Chennai Super Kings enter IPL 2026 at a crossroads, carrying both legacy and last-place disappointment. Major trades, including Jadeja and Curran’s exit and Samson’s arrival, signal a new direction. With gaps in finishing, spin and pace, CSK head into the auction with a big purse and urgent needs as they prepare for life beyond MS Dhoni.

title: One common thing in shareholder protests against salary hikes for Nadella, Musk
content: Microsoft shareholders gave the thumbs up to CEO Satya Nadella's hefty 22% pay raise, even though Norway's massive $2 trillion sovereign wealth fund wasn't on board. This fund, which also questioned Elon Musk's pay, voiced worries about how executives are compensated, their locked-in stock, and the risks tied to key individuals.

title: 'Now or never for Shubman Gill': Former India all-rounder fires warning ahead of T20Is
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan urged Shubman Gill to seize his T20 opening opportunity against South Africa, emphasizing the need to solidify his spot for the 2026 World Cup. Pathan also highlighted the crucial search for a reliable finisher to support Hardik Pandya, naming Axar Patel, Jitesh Sharma, and Rinku Singh as potential candidates for the vital role.

title: Want to use your old smartphone as a home security camera: How to set it up
content: Old smartphones can become home security cameras. This guide shows how to use an old phone with a special app. You can monitor your home, children, or pets easily. This is a cost-effective way to enhance home security. Simply install an app on both phones and pair them. Place the camera strategically for best coverage.

title: Indian student discloses real preparation needed for studying in the UK
content: Lakshita Bhagtani transitioned from biotechnology to management studies at the University of Exeter, navigating the complexities of international education. She highlights the importance of thorough research, managing unexpected expenses like daily transport, and adapting to a new academic environment. Building a community and balancing studies with part-time work were crucial for her successful transition.

title: Praggnanandhaa becomes first Indian to qualify for Candidates 2026
content: Indian chess prodigy R Praggnanandhaa has earned a coveted spot in the Candidates 2026 tournament by triumphing in the FIDE Circuit 2025. His stellar year, marked by victories in major events, secures his sole male representation for India. Seven participants are confirmed, with one remaining spot to be decided by rating.

title: Justin Trudeau and Katy Perry make it Instagram official: A cheat-sheet to their romance
content: The Japan posts marked the inevitable moment when rumour blurred into reality. Perry did not write an essay or offer an explanation. She simply uploaded a carousel of her trip: serene landscapes, neon streets, sushi dinners and then, suddenly, Justin Trudeau, smiling like a man who had very intentionally chosen this era of his life. The caption, “tokyo times on tour and more”, was vague in the way bold announcements often are. The emoji selection — hearts, flowers, soft smiles — did the rest of the heavy lifting. Trudeau, for his part, had already warmed the public to the idea by sharing a photo of the two with Japan’s former prime minister and his wife. It was the sort of diplomatic cameo that would have looked routine if not for the unmistakable sense that something more was happening beyond the frame.

title: Bill Gates' daughter gets $30M for AI app: Gates says won't invest; works helpdesk
content: Phoebe Gates' artificial intelligence shopping startup, Phia, has raised $30 million in new funding. This investment values the company at $180 million. Bill Gates, Phoebe's father, has supported the venture with his time and experience. Phia aims to make online shopping smarter and more sustainable. The app offers price comparisons, discounts, and secondhand options.

title: IndiGo crisis: Pilots say chaos was engineered to force rollback of safety norms
content: IndiGo pilots are raising alarms over a series of unusual flight disruptions, claiming they are part of a deliberate strategy to undermine recent safety regulations. They argue that a minor shortage of pilots doesn’t justify the extensive cancellations observed, hinting at intentional changes in operations that could jeopardize the safety of passengers in favor of profit margins.

title: 'Mango, Paneer ...': Not just chess on Russian GM's mind as GCL makes India debut
content: Russian Grandmaster Volodar Murzin, the 2024 FIDE Rapid champion, is set to compete in the Global Chess League in Mumbai. He expressed his fondness for Indian cuisine, particularly mangoes, paneer, and sugarcane juice. Murzin also shared his confidence boost after winning the World Rapid title and his ambition to improve his classical chess game.

title: From Congress to TMC to BJP: Humayun Kabir’s AIMIM alliance pitch rattles Bengal parties
content: Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir expressed readiness to ally with AIMIM for the 2026 Bengal polls, despite his party's strong criticism. Kabir, who recently laid the foundation for a mosque, also claimed CPM, ISF, and Congress were open to alliances, assertions immediately denied by those parties. His political journey has seen multiple party switches.

title: Bullet train '25: India bets big on steel bridges, mega tunnels & high-speed infra
content: India's first bullet train project is rapidly transforming into a reality, with significant progress on tunnels, bridges, and stations.  The Mumbai-Ahmedabad corridor, built with Japanese technology, is set to revolutionize travel, cutting journey times drastically.  Key milestones in 2025, including advanced tunnel breakthroughs and the adoption of next-gen Shinkansen trains, signal India's entry into the global high-speed rail league.

title: Kournikova & Iglesias Net Worth 2025: Tennis, music, and business earnings
content: Tennis star Anna Kournikova and music icon Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of $160 million in 2025. While Kournikova's fame transcended her $4 million prize money through lucrative endorsements, Iglesias' wealth stems from over 130 million record sales and global tours. Both have strategically invested in Miami real estate, contributing to their substantial shared fortune.

title: Travis Turner case: Veteran cop shares chilling new theory from the woods
content: A missing Virginia football coach, Travis Turner, may never be found. He vanished from his home on November 20. Authorities charged him with child pornography offenses. A law enforcement expert states dense woods and wildlife make recovery difficult. Search teams are using advanced tools, but success remains uncertain. A reward is offered for information leading to his arrest.

title: 'Very strict action': Aviation minister vows to 'set example' after IndiGo crisis
content: Aviation minister K Rammohan Naidu has vowed "very, very strict action" against IndiGo for its recent flight disruptions, citing internal lapses in crew management and roster planning. He clarified the issue is unrelated to past system malfunctions, emphasizing that the airline's mismanagement caused the crisis.  Naidu stressed that accountability is paramount, promising to set an industry example.

title: IndiGo crisis: Over 500 flights cancelled, Rs 827cr refunds initiated — key points
content: IndiGo's operational crisis continues for a seventh day with over 500 flight cancellations nationwide, stranding thousands of passengers. The Supreme Court declined to intervene, acknowledging government action. The airline attributes the disruptions to crew rostering and internal planning issues following new pilot duty time regulations.

title: After wedding cancelled, Smriti Mandhana's brother shares update on her next move
content: India's vice-captain Smriti Mandhana has resumed cricket training following the cancellation of her wedding to composer Palash Muchhal. She will soon return to competitive cricket in a T20I series against Sri Lanka, which serves as preparation for the T20 World Cup. Mandhana had previously confirmed the wedding's cancellation and emphasised her commitment to cricket.

title: US Prez says tariffs can replace federal income taxes — but do the numbers back him?
content: President Trump is again suggesting tariffs could replace federal income taxes, claiming rising tariff revenue will eliminate income tax needs. However, federal data shows individual income taxes are the primary funding source, with tariffs contributing a small fraction. Experts deem the proposal mathematically and economically unworkable, citing disproportionate burdens on lower-income households and risks to economic growth.

title: Common childhood virus found to play a hidden role in bladder cancer development: Study
content: A common childhood virus, BK virus, dormant in the urinary tract, is now linked to DNA damage increasing bladder cancer risk. Research reveals how the body's antiviral response can inadvertently harm its own DNA, explaining cancer development even without viral traces. This discovery offers new prevention avenues beyond smoking cessation.

title: ‘Can I call you Dada?’: TMC MP objects to PM Modi calling Bankim Chandra 'Da’; gets heartful reply
content: Trinamool MP Sugata Roy objected to PM Modi referring to Bankim Chandra Chatterjee as "Bankim Da" in Lok Sabha, suggesting "Bankim Babu" instead. The Prime Minister accepted the correction, highlighting the song's significance in India's struggle against colonial rule and its role in the Swadeshi movement.

title: ‘Only after Manju's statement’: Actor Dileep's 1st remark after rape acquittal; hints at ex-wife
content: Acquitted Malayalam actor Dileep accused police and media of a conspiracy to frame him in the 2017 actress assault case, aiming to ruin his career. He alleged a senior female officer and "criminal-minded" colleagues fabricated a false narrative with media support, which the court has now dismissed.

title: How Bill Gates’ words inspire students worldwide, driving motivation, learning every day
content: Bill Gates, co-founder of Microsoft and philanthropist, inspires students worldwide through his words on learning, ambition, and social responsibility. His messages emphasise lifelong learning, resilience, and innovation, motivating young minds in STEM, entrepreneurship, and global development. Top quotes highlight personal growth, embracing failure, and the importance of technology and guidance. Students report increased engagement, curiosity, and career planning, while his philanthropic focus encourages social awareness. Gates’ guidance continues to shape academic and professional goals globally.

title: Paralysed at 3, suicide attempt at 8: Woman now steers 30 para-cyclists towards national glory
content: Geeta Rao, a paralyzed para-cyclist, overcame immense challenges, including a suicide attempt, to become a trailblazer. Now 46, she's training India's next generation of para-athletes, aiming to put the nation on the global map.  Having qualified for the 2024 Paralympics, Rao's inspiring journey includes international medals and a remarkable Kashmir to Kanyakumari cycle ride.

title: ‘Saurabh Luthra is like a ghost’: Activists slam Goa nightclub owner after fire
content: Goa's Arpora nightclub fire, claiming 25 lives, has spotlighted elusive hospitality entrepreneur Saurabh Luthra. Activists and survivors describe him as a "ghost" rarely present in Goa, with ventures expanding despite alleged safety lapses and lack of official registrations. Investigations reveal critical oversights, raising questions about accountability for the deadly tragedy.

title: Wedding cancelled: Smriti Mandhana & Palash Muchhal unfollow each other on social media
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal have officially called off their wedding, which was previously postponed due to Mandhana's father's hospitalisation. Both stars confirmed the cancellation on Instagram, with Mandhana urging for privacy and emphasising her continued focus on representing India in cricket.

title: Nifty50 goes below 25,900; BSE Sensex down over 700 points - why is market crashing?
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Monday. While Nifty50 went below 25,900 intraday, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points.

title: Made of money! Billionaire club hits record high — How much their children will inherit
content: Global billionaires have reached an all-time high in 2025, with their wealth soaring to $15.8 trillion, largely driven by tech gains in AI. Despite this boom, concerns about tariffs and geopolitical tensions persist. A significant wealth transfer is also underway, with trillions set to pass to heirs in the coming years.

title: 'Bowed to Muslim League': PM Modi's sharp attack on Nehru over Vande Mataram; takes 'MMC' dig at Cong
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi fiercely attacked the Congress in Lok Sabha, accusing the party of compromising on the national song 'Vande Mataram' from the freedom movement to post-Independence. He criticized Jawaharlal Nehru's handling of opposition to the song, stating the Congress "fragmented" it and "bowed to the Muslim League," ultimately leading to the country's partition.

title: ‘Rewriting history’: Gaurav Gogoi slams PM over Vande Mataram debate
content: Congress criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for allegedly rewriting history and politicizing the Lok Sabha debate on 'Vande Mataram'. Deputy leader Gaurav Gogoi accused the PM of repeatedly mentioning Nehru and Congress to revise historical contributions. Gogoi asserted Congress's pivotal role in elevating 'Vande Mataram' to national song status, highlighting its adoption at party sessions.

title: 'Most of them are fire hazards': What makes nightclubs a recipe for disaster
content: Nightclubs in Goa are fire hazards. Experts say many operate without fire department NOCs. Pyrotechnics and combustible materials increase risks. Regulations exist but compliance is low. Basements are particularly dangerous. A recent fire at Romeo Lane highlights these critical issues.

title: 'Stop the character assassination': Ashwin slams toxic fan culture after Gambhir backlash
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has appealed to Indian cricket fans for more constructive online discussions. He highlighted the negative trend of personal attacks following recent team performances. Ashwin stressed that debates should focus on selection and on-field output, not on labeling players. He believes this approach will foster a more positive environment for the sport and its followers.

title: Knives, stones, bullets: Man accused in double-murder case shot dead in Hyderabad
content: A man, an accused in a double murder case, was brutally attacked and killed in Jawaharnagar. Stabbed, bludgeoned with stones, and then shot, the victim was identified as inspector Venkataratnam. Police suspect past enmity as the motive and are using CCTV footage to identify the assailants who fled the scene.

title: ‘True culprit is my mother’: Punjab girl thrown into canal by father 2 months ago 'reappears'
content: A 17-year-old girl, presumed dead for two months after her father allegedly threw her into a canal, has reappeared alive in Ferozepur. She claims her father is innocent, motivated by her mother's instigation, and demands his release while accusing her mother of being the true culprit. Police are investigating the video and will record her official statement.

title: Boost for IAF: Tata - Lockheed Martin announce new defence MRO facility in India
content: India's defence aviation is set for a significant upgrade with Tata Advanced Systems and Lockheed Martin inaugurating a dedicated C-130J Super Hercules MRO facility in Bengaluru. This collaboration strengthens in-country sustainment for the Indian Air Force and aims to serve global operators, boosting India's defence manufacturing capabilities and aerospace ecosystem.

title: Top Google Searches: India crowns teenage phenomenon; Pak obsessed with young Indian opener
content: India's 2025 cricket season saw young stars like Abhishek Sharma and Vaibhav Suryavanshi dominate search trends, even in Pakistan. While India triumphed over rivals on the field, it was these emerging talents who captured global attention, signaling a significant generational shift in cricket's digital landscape and highlighting the growing influence of women's cricket.

title: 'Fear of opp': Aaditya Thackeray targets BJP for charter flights amid IndiGo chaos
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray accused the Maharashtra government of fearing the opposition despite its majority, citing the handling of the Council's Leader of Opposition appointment. He also criticized Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis for deleting a social media post on the IndiGo crisis and questioned the use of chartered flights by BJP leaders amid passenger suffering.

title: RBI MPC meet: What economic signals prompted the 25 basis points rate cut?
content: The Reserve Bank of India has cut the repo rate by 25 basis points, signaling a dovish outlook amid slowing growth expectations. This move, coupled with liquidity infusion measures, aims to boost the real economy. Despite strong headline GDP figures, the policy focuses on future growth sustainability, considering moderating base effects and manageable inflation.

title: Myanmar: Drug production booming amid civil war
content: opium poppy cultivation rose 17% to over 53,000 hectares (131,000 acres) over the past year, the most in a decade . most of the drug is believed to be produced in Myanmar . the combination of rising seizures and falling street prices suggest that production inside Myanmar continues to grow .

title: How teams' Championship Weekend identities will determine their CFP fate
content: the team that won their matchups won because of the identity they've had all season . the blueprint from the weekend tells us what we need to know . here's what really mattered, why it works and how to think about it from betting perspective .

title: The art of drawing flags: Which QBs get the most? Should Justin Herbert argue more?
content: the Chargers beat the Pittsburgh Steelers 25-10 in a week 11 game . the game reflected a season of hits for the team . he has been contacted 149 times and pressured 196 times, both league highs .

title: Salah's Liverpool outburst has echoes of Ronaldo's Man United exit
content: Mohamed Salah was an unused substitute in the side's 3-3 draw against Leeds united . the 33-year-old's post-match interview was as box office as any of the 250 goals he has scored for the club since arriving from AS Roma in 2017 . he said he had been "thrown under the radar of the club"

title: As Hall of Fame welcomes Kent, it prepares to slam door on Bonds and Clemens forever
content: the contemporary baseball era committee's Hall of Fame ballot was announced Sunday . if not for Barry Bonds, Jeff Kent might not be bound for Cooperstown . Kent was on the same ballot as Bonds -- who hit more homers than anyone .

title: Seahawks put spin on OutKast, Migos album covers to poke fun at Falcons
content: the seahawks outscore the Falcons 31-3 in the second half for a road win . the Seahawks now have three halves this season in which they have outscored opponents by at least 28 points . trolls follow up their post-win graphic with "We're so ATL," then write "Peace Up, A-town down"

title: 🏈 CFP to Pop-Tarts: Picking every bowl game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: How all eight teams can win, plus players to watch and biggest questions
content: the college football playoff selection committee's final top 25 of the season produced a 12-team bracket that includes two regular-season rematches in the first round . no. 9 Alabama at No. 8 Oklahoma and no. 11 Tulane at no. 6 Ole Miss beat Alabama, 23-21, on Nov. 15 . the ACC's best team will have a chance to compete for the national title when no. 10 Miami travels to no. 7 Texas A&M .
